snippet: The app, available free for phones on the Android operating system, will allow the Federal Communications Commission to map data transmission speeds and perhaps spur improvements.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission releases its first smartphone app, free program that allows consumers to measure the broadband speed they are getting on their mobile devices and to determine whether it is as fast as wireless companies say.
lead_paragraph: The app, available free for phones on the Android operating system, will allow the Federal Communications Commission to map data transmission speeds and perhaps spur improvements.

headline.main: F.C.C. Smartphone App Gauges Speed of User’s Network
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Smartphone App Gauges Speed of User’s Network
